technology: There were no technical difficulties experienced by the participant.
cur_neg_affect: The participant expresses some negative affect regarding the pandemic, particularly in relation to how the US handled it and the initial fear surrounding the virus.
past_neg_affect: The participant recalls the early days of the pandemic with some negativity, mentioning the fear and uncertainty surrounding the virus.
communal_orientation: The participant engages in the conversation, asks questions, and shares their own experiences, showing a moderate level of communal orientation.
engagement: The participant is actively engaged in the conversation, answering questions thoughtfully, asking follow-up questions, and sharing their own experiences.
defensiveness: The participant does not exhibit any defensive behavior in the conversation.
questions: (06:53) I'm curious what was going through your mind when vaccines were rolled out and kind of late 2020 or early 2021.
(09:36) And now, what was your experience with the vaccine? Did you get sick at all? I I know you said you got it to travel where you 6 for a few days, or kind of very easy process for you.
(12:57) I'm curious what your experience has been with Boosters. If you've gotten any.
(14:37) So did you actually catch the virus at some point?
(15:25) Do you have any idea how you caught it, or who you might have caught it from?

(15:39) I'm wondering what your decisions around vaccinations and boosters are going to be in the near future. For instance, do you think you'll try that? Do you think you're gonna go get the overcrow booster? Do you think you would try a yearly Covid booster shot?
similarity_statements: (14:09) Yeah, I I was a little similar. I only got my first booster and got Covid right after, and it was very like actually meant to get the second booster just to, you know, further, protect myself.
vaccine_importance: The participant believes vaccines are somewhat important, as they got vaccinated to travel and protect themselves, but they don't express extreme importance.
booster_importance: The participant believes boosters are not very important, as they don't plan on getting any more unless there is a severe outbreak.
cognitive_complexity: The participant demonstrates a moderate level of cognitive complexity by considering different perspectives and acknowledging the evolving nature of the virus and its impact.
general_notes: The participant seems relatively cautious and expresses some frustration with how the US handled the pandemic initially. They are open to vaccines but less enthusiastic about boosters unless the situation worsens significantly.
